metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36055 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit SDK versions 2020.1 (and earlier) are affected by a use-after-free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in adobe's 2021.07 code drop

criterions.comment: exempi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
